ai-atk-s0510a20:2_0: In the first of the twentieth part of the Elders was given in the first Vaggumudā.
ai-atk-s0510a20:3_1: The second enclosure through the mountain’s (he said): “After going forth, on the mountain Isipatana, the resident monks have become function of what is beneficial in the God’s created, and when he has arrived at the place where the Elder (Tissa), he said: “Tough I have come to wide open the hermits’ level of the strangth, was covered over the grass, and found it.”
ai-atk-s0510a20:3_2: And having prepared a valuable cloth, he gave it to the Buddha, palace with grass and sticks, which were good for me, before putting it on the Buddha, which is the meaning, of it.
ai-atk-s0510a20:4_0: While phlegm was well sitting on that very day, and now they entered upon the dwelling, wherever there were seven days.
ai-atk-s0510a20:5_0: This is the third kind of graceful stick.
ai-atk-s0510a20:5_1: But in the Elder’s discarded white lotuses at the Cepaka shrine, cut off his legs at the root, made a palm stump, obliterated the garments of the Buddha, and made a pillow made of gravel.
ai-atk-s0510a20:5_2: That’s why it was the third senior monkey,
ai-atk-s0510a20:6_0: The kingdom of the four Elders bound; the King’s workers (himself) called “give”; his attendant is the meaning.
